intro: Amoria hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid amoria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Amoria hybrida thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
